channel.title: [PI] 317 Adding Custom NPC and Adding Custom ITEMS Beginner
channel.description:
First of ALL items
Uh Yeah i added a custom item which is Guitar BASS and a GLOCK but the client SHOWS another which is kind of Frustrating
i have the MODELS for the ITEMS but i don't have the INTS
if (i == 87) { itemDef.modelID = 87; itemDef.name = "Guitar Bass"; //name for the custom itemDef.description = "It's a guitar Bass" + itemDef.name; //definition itemDef.modelZoom = 2050; <---what does this do? itemDef.modelRotation1 = 222; <---what does this do? itemDef.modelRotation2 = 1958; <---what does this do? itemDef.modelOffset1 = 0; <---what does this do? itemDef.modelOffset2 = -28; <---what does this do? itemDef.anInt165 = 73362; <---what does this do? itemDef.anInt200 = 73362; <<---what does this do? itemDef.groundActions = new String[5]; itemDef.groundActions[2] = "Take"; // when you see it in the ground itemDef.itemActions = new String[5]; itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wear"; // on your inv itemDef.itemActions[4] = "Drop"; // ^ SAME }
can someone explain this to me? like where do i put the model for my custom items.. since all i see is another GODSWORD it doesn't show the GUITAR BASS :#?
also where do i put the drop model?
AND FOR NPC
i added a Spongebob.. don't have the ints too when i spawn it .. its invisible XD
anyhelp?

item.title: [PI] 317 Adding Custom NPC and Adding Custom ITEMS Beginner
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

xavier786:

Bump someone please explain the values he pointed out in his config file

he is probably you under a different name…

Anyways. Here’s your explanation:
itemDef.modelID = 87;// The inventory model ID - what you see when in inventory and on the ground.
itemDef.name = “Guitar Bass”; // Item name
itemDef.description = “It’s a guitar Bass” + itemDef.name; // Item Description. Seen upon hitting "examine"
itemDef.modelZoom = 2050;// The zoom of the model in the inventory. Higher = further. Lower = closer.
itemDef.modelRotation1 = 222;// The X rotation of the model… I believe, it may be the Y rotation. This is also an ‘in inventory’ thing.
itemDef.modelRotation2 = 1958;// The same as X rotation, but Y.
itemDef.modelOffset1 = 0;// The X offset in the inventory. ++ makes it go right. – makes it go left. This may also be Y. In which case, ++ goes up, – goes down.
itemDef.modelOffset2 = -28;// The same as the X offset, but Y.
itemDef.anInt165 = 73362;// Male wearing ID. the id of the model the male character uses.
itemDef.anInt200 = 73362;// ^ But female. I might have these confused.
itemDef.groundActions = new String[5];// Array of actions when you drop the item
itemDef.groundActions[2] = “Take”; // Third ground action in array
itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];// Array of actions when it’s in inventory
itemDef.itemActions[1] = “Wear”; // Second inventory action
itemDef.itemActions[4] = “Drop”; // 5th Inventory action.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] 317 Adding Custom NPC and Adding Custom ITEMS Beginner

item.title: [PI] 317 Adding Custom NPC and Adding Custom ITEMS Beginner
item.dc:creator: @hnco04 hnco04
item.description:
@hnco04 wrote:

[quote=“horses2007, post:2, topic:549210”]Put the models in your raw folder in your cache, that should work.

atleast thats how i do it on my pi[/quote]

UH… to be Honest i think this answer is kinda stupid…(SORRY ABOUT THIS :3) i did say i already added it…
Anyways glad you replied tho…

my problem is about the ints? since i dont have INT of the things i wanted to add… i dont really know what to do with it…

item.title: [PI] 317 Adding Custom NPC and Adding Custom ITEMS Beginner
item.dc:creator: @hnco04 hnco04
item.description:
@hnco04 wrote:

First of ALL items

Uh Yeah i added a custom item which is Guitar BASS and a GLOCK
but the client SHOWS another which is kind of Frustrating

i have the MODELS for the ITEMS
but i don’t have the INTS

if (i == 87) {
itemDef.modelID = 87;
itemDef.name = “Guitar Bass”; //name for the custom
itemDef.description = “It’s a guitar Bass” + itemDef.name; //definition
itemDef.modelZoom = 2050; <—what does this do?
itemDef.modelRotation1 = 222; <—what does this do?
itemDef.modelRotation2 = 1958; <—what does this do?
itemDef.modelOffset1 = 0; <—what does this do?
itemDef.modelOffset2 = -28; <—what does this do?
itemDef.anInt165 = 73362; <—what does this do?
itemDef.anInt200 = 73362; <<—what does this do?
itemDef.groundActions = new String[5];
itemDef.groundActions[2] = “Take”; // when you see it in the ground
itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
itemDef.itemActions[1] = “Wear”; // on your inv
itemDef.itemActions[4] = “Drop”; // ^ SAME
}

can someone explain this to me? like where do i put the model for my custom items… since all i see is another GODSWORD
it doesn’t show the GUITAR BASS :#?

also where do i put the drop model?

AND FOR NPC

i added a Spongebob… don’t have the ints too
when i spawn it … its invisible XD

anyhelp?
